Articles.Content:
I am a Noob player just starting out in the career mode and found last night after v1.1.3 I had difficulty re-entering from my first mission to orbit Mun. I used several aerobraking passes and managed to get ap 65km and Pe 32km while at 65km on my third pass. Velocity was around 2400m/s. I thought this would be a cake walk to re-enter with this profile noting I had:

a heat shield; 

Jnr science; 

small bay with goo, thermometer and barometer; 

hexagonal remote module with solar panels and batteries;

2x radial Doogue and normal chutes.

Previously (v1.1.2) I have re-entered with a higher ap and a similar Pe and velocity. This was with no heat shield and a mk1 command module and Jnr science no worries. Am I missing something? I had to "cheat" by pointing the nose up and down rapidly to temporarily reset the heating bar on the heat shield as it was constantly in the red.

Not sure what the problem is.  Can you specify what you mean by "had difficulty"?  Heat shields get a heat bar, no problem.  Were you actually overheating and exploding?  Exactly what was the problem?

A small craft like you describe should reenter from the Mun just fine.  Don't even need to make multiple passes-- just do a single reentry with a Pe around 30 km and it'll reenter and land directly.  (You actually make life worse by yourself by doing multiple passes:  it generates a lot more heat per amount of drag, so it's easy to run out of ablator.)

On 23 June 2016 at 7:49 AM, Snark said:

Not sure what the problem is.  Can you specify what you mean by "had difficulty"?  Heat shields get a heat bar, no problem.  Were you actually overheating and exploding?  Exactly what was the problem?

A small craft like you describe should reenter from the Mun just fine.  Don't even need to make multiple passes-- just do a single reentry with a Pe around 30 km and it'll reenter and land directly.  (You actually make life worse by yourself by doing multiple passes:  it generates a lot more heat per amount of drag, so it's easy to run out of ablator.)

 

I undertook the aerobraking passes as I could not enter without exploding on mutiple attempts prior (all were in 3000 m/s and 30-35 km Pe range). By "had difficulty" I mean my heat shield bar was red (95% full) and would have maxed out and exploded if I hadn't performed the "cheat". My aero braking passes was with an engine still attached so my ablative was still 100%. It finished on about 170 out of 200 from memory. I will test out my older suborbital rockets tonight and see if they have changed. If I still have the quick save file I will try and get some screenshots.

Edited June 24, 2016 by Beagle

It looks like it may have been a file curruption or program stability issue. My other vessels seem OK and when I try to reload the specific quick save file everything hangs on the loading screen. Watching YouTube vids post v1.0 it was clearly not normal behaviour.

Thanks for taking the time to reply Snark.

Edited June 24, 2016 by Beagle
